chapter.title: Chapter II
chapter.subtitle: Sankhya-yoga
chapter.description: The second chapter of Srimad Bhagavad Gita proper is known as Sankhya Yoga.

dedication.meaning: I serve the lotus feet of the fearless one, who gives joy to the devotees

verses.Language:
Sanjay Ubach
Tang tath Kripayavistamsrupurnakulekshanam.
Vishidantamidang vakamubach madhusudan:..1..
verses.translation: Sanjay said - Seeing Arjuna thus repentant, distraught and tearful, Madhusudan or Sri Krishna, overcome with grace, spoke these words.
verses.speaker: Sanjay

verses.Language:
Shri Bhagwanubach
Kutstva kashmalmidang bishme samupasthitam.
Anaryajustamsvargyamkirtikaramarjuna..2..
verses.translation: Lord Purushottama said-Dear Arjuna, how did those who do not understand the precious value of life in this dire battleground, how did the grief of those who do not understand the honor of the Anarya ignited in your heart? Such an attitude will not elevate you to heaven, but will destroy all your wealth.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Klaibyang ma sm gama: Partha naitattvayuppadya.
3.
verses.translation: O Parth! This honor is harmful. Don't be clingy. Such behavior is inappropriate for you. O Parantapa!Abandon this small weakness of heart and stand up.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Kathang Bhishmahang Sankhye Dronang Ch Madhusudan.
Ishuvi: Pratiyotsyami Pujarhabarisudan..4..
verses.translation: Arjuna said - O Arisudan! O Madhusudan! How shall I contest with arrows the supremely venerable ones like Bhishma and Drona on this battlefield?
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
The Guru is the great
Shreyo bhoktung bhaikshyampeeh loke.
Hatvarthakamastu Gurunihaiva
Bhunjiya Bhagan Rudhir Pradigdhan
verses.translation: It is better to live by begging than to enjoy this world by losing the life of my great teachers. Although they are greedy for worldly things, they are my elders. If they are killed, all war supplies will be stained with their blood.
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
Na chaitad vidma: katarannno garyo
Yad or Jayem if or no Jayyu.
Ganeb hatva na jijibishams
Tehvasthita and Dhartarashtra. 6.
verses.translation: I do not understand whether it is better to conquer them, or to be defeated by them. If we kill Dhritarashtra's sons, we will not want to live anymore. Yet they appear before us on this battlefield.
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
Karpanyadosopahatsvabhava:
Prichchami tang dharmasammudhcheta:
Yachareya: sannischitong bruhi tanme
Shishyastehhong Shadhi Mang Thang Prapannam.
verses.translation: I am now bewildered and confused about my duties under the influence of Karpanya weakness. In this situation I ask you, tell me what is best for me to do now. I am now your disciple and completely dependent on you. Please guide me.
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
Na hi propasyami mamapanudyad
Yachchokamuchchoshanmindriyanam.
Abapya Bhumavaspatnamrdhang
Rajyang Suranampi Chadhipatyam..8..
verses.translation: I can find no way to remove the grief that withers my senses. Even if I gain in this world a prosperous, unopposed kingdom with dominion like the gods of heaven, this sorrow of mine will not perish.
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
Abmuktba Hrishikeshang Gurakesh: Parantap.
Na yotsya iti govindmuktba tushning babhuv ha..9..
verses.translation: Sanjay said-Thus expressing his attitude Gurakesh Arjuna then said to Hrishikesh, "O Govinda! I will not fight", saying that he remained silent.
verses.speaker: Sanjay

verses.Language:
Tamubach Hrishikesh: Parhasanniv Bharat.
10.
verses.translation: O Bharata dynasty Dhritarashtra! Smiling at that, Lord Krishna spoke this to the dejected Arjuna in the midst of the soldiers on both sides.
verses.speaker: Sanjay

verses.Language:
Shri Bhagwanubach
Asochanyanabsochachstong prajnabadangscha bhasse.
11.
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said - You are talking like a prophet, but you are mourning over things that should not be mourned. Those who are properly learned never mourn for anyone living or dead.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Na twebahang jatu nasong na twang neme janadhipah.
Neither Chaiva nor Bhavishyam: Sarbe Boymat: Param..12..
verses.translation: There was never a time when I, you and all these kings did not exist and we will never cease to exist.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Dehinohsmin is the body's youthfulness.
That's why it's not necessary to transfer the body. 13.
verses.translation: Just as the physical body changes its form through youth, youth and old age, at the time of death the physical body (soul) is transferred from one body to another body. Established scholars never notice this change.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Maritasparshastu kaunteya shitoshanasukhduhkhada:
14.
verses.translation: O Kaunteya! The association of matter with the senses results in the experience of eternal happiness and sorrow. They are just like winter and summer seasons. O Bharatakula-Pradipa!Try to endure those sense sensations without being affected by them.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Jang Hee is a manly man.
Samadukhsukhang dhirang sohmrattvaye kalpate..15..
verses.translation: O great man (Arjuna)! A wise person who knows happiness and sorrow equally and is not disturbed by the primordial conflict of cold and hot is the true possessor of liberation.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Nasto Vidyate Bhabo Nabhabo Vidyate Satah
16.
verses.translation: Those theoreticians have concluded that eternal matter has no permanence and eternal matter soul never perishes. They have come to this conclusion by realizing the true nature of both natures.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Abinashi tu tadviddhi as sarvamidang tatam.
17.
verses.translation: That which pervades the whole body, you will know as imperishable. No one is able to destroy that precocious soul.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Antavant ime deha nityasyokta: body
Anashinohprameyasya Tasmad Yudhyasva Bharat..18..
verses.translation: The physical body of the imperishable, immeasurable and eternal soul is undoubtedly imperishable. So O India! You fight without abandoning your scriptural self-religion.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Ya and Betti Hantarang Yaschinang Monyate Hatam.
Ubhou tou na bijanito nayang hanti na hanyate..19..
verses.translation: He who thinks that the soul is dead, or he who thinks that it is dead, both do not know the true nature of the soul. Because the soul does not kill anyone and is not killed by anyone.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Never die or never die
Nayang bhutva bhabita or na bhuyah.
Ajo Nitya: Shasvatohyang Purano
No Hanyate Hanymane in the body.
verses.translation: The soul never takes birth or dies, nor does it arise or grow again and again. He is eternally born, eternal and old yet eternally new. Though the body perishes, the soul never perishes.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Bedabinashinong nityang ya enmajambayam.
Kathang Sa Purush: Parth Kong Ghatayati Hanti Kom..21..
verses.translation: O Parth! He who knows this soul as imperishable, eternal, birthless and indestructible, whom does he kill or who is killed?
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Basangsi Jirnani namely Biha
Nabani is a narcissist.
Also, the body tissues are worn out.
Nani Sanyati Nabani Dehi..22..
verses.translation: Just as a person sheds his old clothes and puts on new clothes, so the body sheds his worn-out body and takes on a new body.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Nainang Chindanti Shastrani Nainang Dahti Pubk:.
Na chainang kledayantayapo na shoshayati marutah..23..
verses.translation: Souls cannot be cut by weapons, burned by fire, soaked in water, or dried by wind.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Achdyohayamdahyohayamkledyohsoshoshya and f.
Nitya: Sarvagata: Sthanurchaloyang Sanatan: ..24..
verses.translation: This soul is indestructible, indestructible, indestructible and inexhaustible. He is eternal, all-pervading, unchanging, immovable and eternal.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Avyaktohayamchintyohayambikaryohayamuchyate.
25.
verses.translation: This soul is described in the scriptures as unmanifest, unthinking and immutable. Therefore, knowing this eternal form, you should not grieve for the body.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Atha chainang nityajatang nityang or manyase mrittam.
Yet Twang Mahabaho Naibong Sochitumarhsi..26..
verses.translation: O Mahabaho! And if you think that the soul is born and dies again and again, you have no reason to grieve.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Jatasya hi dhrubo mrityudhruvang janma mritysya f.
27.
verses.translation: Death of one who is born is inevitable and birth of one who dies is inevitable. Therefore you should not mourn while performing essential duties.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Abyaktadini Bhutani Vyaktmadhyani India.
Abyaktnidhnanyeva tatra ka paridevana..28..
verses.translation: O India! All created beings were unmanifested before they arose, remained unmanifested during their stasis, and became unmanifested again after destruction. So, why mourn for that?
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
The amazing ending is Kashiden-
Mascharyavdvdati tathiva chanya:
अश्वाबच्चाचिनम्या: Shranoti
Shrutapayenang Veda na Chaiva Kaschit..29..
verses.translation: Some see this soul with wonder, some describe it with wonder, and some hear with wonder, and some do not understand it even when they hear it.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Dehi Nityamvadhyohayong Dehi Sarvasya Bharat.
Tasmat sarvani bhutani na twang sochitumarhsi..30..
verses.translation: O India! The soul residing in the bodies of animals is always present. Therefore you should not mourn for any living being.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Swadharmapi chavekshya na bikompitumarhsi.
Dharmyaddhi Yudachchreyo ᦽnyat Kshatriyasya na Vidyate..31..
verses.translation: As a kshatriya considering your own dharma you should know that nothing is better for a kshatriya than to fight for the sake of dharma. So, you should not hesitate.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Jadrichchaya Choppannang Swargadwarampavaritam.
Sukhin: Kshatriya: Partha Lavante Judhamidrisham..32..
verses.translation: O Parth! Happy are those Kshatriyas who come to the Opener of Heaven without seeking the opportunity to participate in this kind of religious war.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Ath chet tmimang dharmyang sangramang na karishyasi.
Tatah swadharmang kirtincha hitta papambapsyasi..33..
verses.translation: But, if you do not fight this religious war, then your own religion and fame will be corrupted and suffer sin.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Akirtinchapi Bhutani Kathayishyanti Tehvyam.
34.
verses.translation: All men will speak of your worthlessness, and for any honorable man this dishonor is worse than death.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Vayadranaduparatang mangsyante tang maharatha.
Jeshang cha twang bahumto Gatirveda na Budhaya:..35..
verses.translation: All the Maharathis will think that you have abandoned the battlefield out of fear, and those to whom you were respected will despise you.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Unpronounceable multi-directionality.
Nindantastava samarthyang tato dukhatarang nu kim..36..
verses.translation: Your enemies will speak many unspeakable things against your ability. What could be more painful for you?
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Hatta or prapsyasi swarang jitta or bhokshyase mahim.
37.
verses.translation: O Kuntiputra! If you are killed in this battle, you will gain heaven, and if you win, you will enjoy the earth. So rise up determined for battle.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Sukhdukhe Same Kirtba Lavalavhou Jayajoyou.
Tato Yuddaya Yujyaswa Naibong Papambapsiasi..38..
verses.translation: If you fight for the sake of fighting, knowing happiness and sorrow, profit and loss and victory and defeat equally, then you will not be guilty of sin.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Esha Tehvihita Sankhya is very intelligent.
Buddhya Yukto Yaya Partha Karmabandhang Prahasyasi..39..
verses.translation: O Parth! I told you about Sankhya-yoga. Now listen to the wisdom of bhakti yoga, by which you can be freed from the bonds of karma.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Nehavikramanashohasti pratyabayo na vidyate.
40.
verses.translation: The practice of Bhakti Yoga never fails and has no decay. His short ceremony also frees the devotee from the great fear of samsararupa.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Vayasayatmika Buddhirnakeh Kurunandan.
Bahushakha Hayanantascha Buddhayohvyabsayinam..41..
verses.translation: The assurance of those who have adopted this path is that their intellect is sincere. O Kurunandana, the intellect of restless-minded people is multi-branched and outward-looking.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Jamimang Pushpitang Bachong Pravadantya Vipaschit:
Vedabadrata: Partha Nanyandanti Badin: ..42..
verses.translation: It is the unscrupulous people who are addicted to the flowery words of the Vedas and consider the ultimate goal of life to be heavenly bliss, birth in the upper clan, and gain power. Attracted to sensual pleasures and riches, they say that there is nothing above that.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Kamatman: The result of heavenly birth karma.
Adverbs, especially Bhogaishwaryagataing Prati. 43.
verses.translation: Those who are completely addicted to enjoyment and opulence, those unscrupulous and foolish people do not attain Buddhi Samadhi i.e. devotion to God.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Traigunyasya Abiya Veda Nistraigunyo Bhavarjuna.
44.
verses.translation: The Vedas mainly discuss the three qualities of material nature. O Arjuna! You transcend those qualities and attain the Nirguna level. Be freed from all conflicts and be freed from the anxiety of profit and loss and self-preservation and become possessed of spiritual consciousness.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Yabanartha Udpana Sarvat Samplutoke.
Taban Sarveshu Vedeshu Brahmanasya Vijanat: 45.
verses.translation: All the needs that are met in small water bodies are automatically met by large water bodies. Similarly, to one who has realized the purpose of everything by worshiping the Lord, the purpose of all the Vedas has been attained.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Karmanya sharikasara ma faleshhu kadachan.
Ma karmaphalheturbhurma te Sangohastvakarmani..46..
verses.translation: You have a right to do what is prescribed by Swadharma, but you do not have a right to any karma. Never think of yourself as the cause of karma, and never become addicted to not practicing self-righteousness.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Yogastha: Kuru Karmani Sangang Tyaktba Dhananjay.
Siddhyasiddhyo: Samo Bhutva Samtong Yoga Uchyate..47..
verses.translation: O Arjuna! Abandoning the desire for fruit, engage in devotion and perform actions prescribed by Swadharma. The understanding of the success and failure of action is called yoga.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Karma Buddhiyogadhananjaya is far away.
48.
verses.translation: O Dhananjay! Abstain from sakam karma by practicing bhakti through buddhiyoga and take refuge in the Lord by holding on to that consciousness. Those who want to enjoy the fruits of their actions are miserly.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Intelligent Jahatih Uve Sukrta Duskrite.
Yujyasva Yoga in Tasmad Yoga: Karmasu Kausalam..49..
verses.translation: One who practices devotion to God is freed from both sin and virtue in this life. Therefore, you perform the ceremony of Niskam Karma Yoga. That is the overall strategy.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Karmajang Buddhiyukta Hi Falang Tyaktba Manishin:
Janambandhavinirmukta: Padang Gachchantyachyutam..50..
verses.translation: By engaging in the service of the Lord, the sages give up the fruits of action and are freed from the bonds of birth and death. Thus they attain the state of past all miseries.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Jada te mohaklilong buddhirvyatiritrishyati.
Tada gantasi nirvedang shrotavyasya shrutasya f..51..
verses.translation: Thus, when your intellect has completely transcended the deep forest of the seal of the Supreme Lord, practicing the empty actions assigned to the Supreme Lord, you will be able to become completely neutral to all that you have heard and all that is audible.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Shrutivipratipanna te jada sthasyasi nichla.
52
verses.translation: When your intellect is no longer disturbed by the strange language of the Vedas and is settled in the samadhi of self-realization, you will attain divine knowledge and attain devotion.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Arjun Ubach
Sthitprajnasya ka bhasha samadhisthasya Keshav.
53.
verses.translation: Arjuna asked - Keshav! What are the signs of people with fixed intelligence? How do they talk, how do they stand and how do they walk?
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
Prajahati jada kaman sarvan partha manogatan.
54.
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said - O Partha! When the living being renounces all mental activities arising from mental speculations and when his mind is thus purified and attains full satisfaction in the Self, then he is called Sthitaprajna.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Dukheshvanudvignamana: Sukheshu Bigataspriha:
55.
verses.translation: Three Penances He whose mind is not agitated even when sorrow is present, who is not agitated even when happiness is present and who is free from anger, fear and anger, is Stithadhi i.e. Steadfast.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Yah samsaraanvisnehastatta prapya subhashubham.
Navinandati na dvesti tasya pragya established. 56.
verses.translation: He who is everywhere anavisneha i.e. not attached to any thing and receiving auspicious results neither praises nor hates, his wisdom is established.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Jada Sangang Chayati Karmani Ch Sarbash.
Indriyaanindriyarthevya: wisdom established..57..
verses.translation: When a living being's senses are completely detached from sense objects, then his wisdom is established.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Nirahasya dehin in the subject matter.
Rasobarjang Rasohapyasya Parang Drishta nivirta..58..
verses.translation: When the senses of the material person are restrained from matter, his rasa-barjari rasa is also restrained by seeing the Supreme Soul.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
As much as Happi Kaunteya Purushya Bipaschitah.
Indriyani pravamayan haranti prasabhang mana:..59..
verses.translation: O Kaunteya! Although the wise man tries to restrain the senses, the senses forcefully take over his mind.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Tani sarvaani sanyamya yukta asit motpara:
60.
verses.translation: O Arjuna! Stay attached to God by restraining all the senses. He whose senses are subdued, his wisdom is established.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Dhyaito Abhiyan Puns: Sangastesupajayate.
61.
verses.translation: From meditation on the affairs of men arises attachment to him. From attachment arises desire and from desire arises anger.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Ragadveshavimuktaistu Abhyayanindriyaishcharan.
62.
verses.translation: While wandering about things with the senses free from anger and resentment, the Vidhyatma obtains Prasad through the senses subdued.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Prasad Sarvadukhkhanang Hanirsyopzayate.
Prasannachetso hi Buddhi: pratishthita..63..
verses.translation:
Prasad Sarvadukhkhanang Hanirsyopzayate.
Prasannachetso hi Buddhi: pratishthita..63..
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Nasti buddhiroyuktsya na chayuktsya bhavana.
Na chabhavayat: shantirshantasya kutah sukham..64..
verses.translation: The unattached person has no intelligence, no thought and no peace. Where is the happiness of the troubled person?
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Indrianang hi chartang janmanohnuvidhyate.
Tadsya harti prajjang bayurnavamibambhsi..65..
verses.translation: He whose mind is a follower of the senses, his wisdom snatches away as the wind snatches the boat from the water.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Tasmadyasya Mahabaho Nigrhitani Sarvasha.
66.
verses.translation: O Mahabaho! His wisdom is established, whose senses are completely withdrawn from the objects of the senses.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Which is Nisha Sarbhuthanang Tsyang Jagrati Samyami.
Yasyang jagrati bhutani sa nisha pashyato muneh..67..
verses.translation: Sanyamami is awake to that target which is the target of all ghosts. Which is the waking state of all ghosts, that is definitely the Nisha of Muni.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Apooryamanamachalapratisthang Samudramapa: Pravishanti Jadvat.
Then Kama Jang Pravishanti Sarve Sa Shantimapnoti Na Kamakami..68..
verses.translation: As water enters the sea and does not lose its immutability and immovability, so he who enters into all desires attains peace and is not lustful.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Bihay Kaman Jada Saravan Norm Paschim Asrit:.
Nirmamo Nirahankar: Sa Shantimdhigachti..69..
verses.translation: When man renounces all desires and becomes Westernized and becomes ruthless and unconcealed, he attains peace.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Esha Brahmi Stiti: Partha nainang prapya bimuhyati.
70.
verses.translation: O Parth! This is the Brahmi status. No one is disillusioned by receiving it. Staying in this state, he attained Brahmanirdhana at the end of his life.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Bihay Kaman Jada Saravan Norm Paschim Asrit:.
Nirmamo Nirahankar: Sa Shantimdhigachti..71..
verses.translation: When man renounces all desires and becomes Westernized and becomes ruthless and unconcealed, he attains peace.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Esha Brahmi Stiti: Partha Nainang prapya bimuhyati.
72.
verses.translation: O Parth! This is the Brahmi status. No one is disillusioned by receiving it. Staying in this state, he attained Brahmanirdhana at the end of his life.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

summary.title: Chapter II - Sankhya-yoga
summary.description: In this chapter Sri Krishna explains to Arjuna the means of liberation from karmabandhan through Sankhya-Yoga and Bhakti-Yoga. Arjuna's grief is relieved and he is inspired to wage a religious war.
